item.title: ‘Leanne’ Review: Leanne Morgan’s Chuck Lorre-Produced Netflix Comedy Is a Reliably Nice Time
item.description: The standup comedian stars as a 50something woman who’s just been dumped by her husband of three decades, alongside an ensemble cast including Kristen Johnson, Ryan Stiles and Celia Weston.

item.title: ‘Hitmakers’ Review: Music’s Biggest Pens Struggle to Make a Hit of This Shallow Netflix Reality Series About Pop Songwriting
item.description: The new series from the creator of ‘Selling Sunset’ gathers top songwriters and tasks them with crafting hits for artists including John Legend, Usher, Shaboozey and Blackpink’s Lisa.

item.description: It’s pretty indisputable that the most crucial part of the music industry — the songwriter — is the most overlooked and, in most cases, shortchanged. With the rising dominance of streaming over the pa

item.title: Hulu’s ‘Washington Black’ Doesn’t Capture the Majesty of the Novel: TV Review
item.description: From “Kindred” to “Underground” and 2016’s reimagining of “Roots,” television has not shied away from depicting a wide range of stories about enslaved people.

item.title: Critic’s Notebook: Ozzy Osbourne Created the Template for Reality TV Celebrity Reinvention, From Flavor Flav to Donald Trump
item.description: Transformed by ‘The Osbournes’ from bird-biting Prince of Darkness into one of TV’s quintessential bumbling dads, Osbourne helped usher in a wave of image makeovers with unexpectedly lasting ripples.

item.title: ‘Hurricane Katrina: Race Against Time’ Review: NatGeo’s Ryan Coogler-Produced Docuseries Is a Potent 20th-Anniversary Reflection
item.description: Traci A. Curry’s five-parter looks back at the lessons learned, and why we can’t forget the tragic aspects that were man-made.

item.title: ‘Washington Black’ Review: Sterling K. Brown in a Hulu Drama That Tackles Heavy History With Disarming Lightness of Spirit
item.description: Adapted from Esi Edugyan’s 2018 novel, the miniseries chronicles the globe-trotting adventures of a boy who escapes slavery in Barbados and winds up in Nova Scotia.

item.title: ‘The Hunting Wives’ Review: Malin Akerman and Brittany Snow Get Hot and Bothered in Netflix’s Deliciously Trashy Drama
item.description: A Bostonian moves to Texas and falls in with a socialite and her wealthy circle of housewives in this thriller adapted from the novel by May Cobb.

item.title: Critic’s Notebook: The Awful Optics of CBS Canceling ‘The Late Show With Stephen Colbert’
item.description: Does the end of Colbert’s show in May 2026 relate to the Paramount-Skydance merger? To Colbert’s criticism of Donald Trump? To the demise of late night television? Who’s to say?

item.title: ‘Untamed’ Review: Eric Bana and Lily Santiago Anchor Netflix’s Intriguing but Rushed Yosemite-Set Mystery
item.description: Co-created by ‘American Primeval’ scribe Mark L. Smith, this six-episode thriller traces a murder investigation in the famous national park.
